main event: On 20 July 1956 in Terre Haute, Indiana, a ground-radar observation was made of a round object estimated to be 2500 to 3000 feet in diameter, at a height of 8,000 feet, and moving at a speed of about 600 mph.
interesting points: The UFO was observed via ground radar, indicating a technological means of detection.
The estimated size of the object was exceptionally large, at 2500 to 3000 feet in diameter.
The object was reportedly moving at a high speed of about 600 mph.
There are no further details provided about the nature or behavior of the UFO.
The report does not offer any conclusive explanation or findings for the observed object.
sighted object: round object estimated to be 2500 to 3000 feet in diameter
